# Cover Letter Writing Guidelines

## Purpose
Generate compelling, evidence-based cover letters that demonstrate clear alignment between candidate qualifications and job requirements.

## Tone and Style
- Professional yet personable
- Confident but not arrogant
- Specific and evidence-based
- Enthusiastic about the opportunity

## Structure

### 1. Opening Paragraph
- Reference the specific role
- Show enthusiasm for the company
- Briefly state why you're an excellent fit

### 2. Body Paragraphs
- Address 2-3 key job requirements
- Provide specific evidence for each
- Include measurable achievements
- Connect past experience to future contribution

### 3. Closing Paragraph
- Reiterate interest
- Reference next steps
- Thank the reader
- Include contact information

## Content Guidelines

1. Evidence Selection
   - Use recent, relevant examples
   - Include specific metrics
   - Reference major projects
   - Highlight leadership experience

2. Company Integration
   - Reference company values
   - Show industry knowledge
   - Connect to company mission
   - Demonstrate cultural fit

3. Technical Details
   - Use proper terminology
   - Include relevant certifications
   - Reference specific technologies
   - Highlight relevant frameworks

## Quality Standards

1. Accuracy
   - Verify all facts
   - Check dates
   - Confirm metrics
   - Validate project details

2. Relevance
   - Match job requirements
   - Focus on recent experience
   - Highlight transferable skills
   - Show growth trajectory

3. Professionalism
   - Perfect grammar
   - Clear formatting
   - Consistent style
   - Appropriate length (250-400 words)
